info.description: !D Cloud is an RFID integration platform for retail stores. While we provide core functionality for retail companies, a lot of functionality can be added or extended by 3rd party developers. We encourage you to do so!
info.title: !D Cloud API

get.description: Exports an approved difference list, using the approved difference list identifier. This endpoint returns the approved difference list with only one quantity per GTIN: the RFID quantity if the difference for that GTIN has been approved, otherwise the ERP quantity. This endpoint returns all GTINs, even the ones where RFID and ERP quantities are equal.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Approved difference list identifier.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Type of file to return.

get.description: Retrieves a list of approved difference list summaries for a given store.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location identifier of the store to retrieve the approved difference lists for.

parameters.name: from_rfid_time
parameters.description: Approved difference lists with RFID count time after this value will be returned.

parameters.name: until_rfid_time
parameters.description: Approved difference lists with RFID count time before this value will be returned.

get.description: Retrieves an approved difference list, using the approved difference list identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the approved difference list

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Type of file to return.

get.description: Returns the summary of an approved difference list for a certain location and RFID count time.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location identifier of the store to retrieve the approved difference list summary for.

parameters.name: rfid_time
parameters.description: Date and time of the RFID count.

post.summary: Update approved difference list export status
post.description: Updates the export status of an approved difference list.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the approved difference list.

parameters.name: export_status
parameters.description: New export status of the approved difference list.

get.description: Finds articles based on a search query that allows search in all fields.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query. Comma separated values to search for in the articles database (â€˜AND' query). Search will be executed on all fields and is case insensitive

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Return this number of articles.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Skip this number of articles. When omitted: skip none.

parameters.name: extern_ref
parameters.description: This can be used to match requests with responses from the server (for example, Ajax requests are asynchronous and thus can return out of sequence).

parameters.name: order[]
parameters.description: Column to which ordering should be applied. When omitted: default order wil be based on score.

get.description: Returns the total quantity of articles stored.

Retrieves articles. There are three ways to call this endpoint:
 * 1. specify GTINs,
 * 2. specify barcodes, or
 * 3. specify updated_after, skip and count.
 You can not mix these sets: skip and count have no meaning when specifying gtins or barcodes, and combining gtins and updated_after also doesn't work.

parameters.name: gtins[]
parameters.description: The GTIN(s) of which article information should be returned. Repeat key-value for retrieving multiple GTINs. Mutually exclusive with barcodes[] and updated_after.

parameters.name: barcodes[]
parameters.description: The barcode(s) of which article information should be returned. Repeat key-value for retrieving multiple barcodes. Mutually exclusive with gtins[] and updated_after.

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description: Articles updated on or after this time. When omitted: return all Article objects since 1 january 1970.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Skip this number of articles. When omitted: skip none.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Return this number of articles. The maximum number of returned articles is limited at 50.000. When omitted: return 100 Article objects.

parameters.name: fields[]
parameters.description:
Which fields should be included in the response. Can be any of the Article fields.
When omitted: all fields will be included in the response.

post.description: Creates or replaces article(s). Articles are replaced using the GTIN as primary key.

parameters.name: articles
parameters.description: A list of articles that should be created or replaced.

post.description: Creates or updates article(s). Articles are updated using the GTIN as primary key.

parameters.name: articles
parameters.description: A list of articles that should be updated.

delete.description: Deletes specified articles from the database. This cannot be undone! Please note the articles are not deleted from the apps. To do that, reset the app and re-register using the QR code.

parameters.name: gtins[]
parameters.description: GTIN(s) to delete. Repeat key-value for deleting multiple articles.

delete.description: Deletes all articles from the database. This cannot be undone! Please note the articles are not deleted from the apps. To do that, reset the app and re-register using the QR code.

get.description: Retrieves GTIN-based difference list for a single location. By default, only items with an ERP stock quantity that is different from the RFID count quantity are returned.

parameters.name: erp_stock_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the ERP stock to use.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Date and time of the RFID count to be used.

parameters.name: only_differences
parameters.description: When set to true, only differences will be returned. When set to false, all GTINs in the ERP stock or RFID stock will be returned (except when both are zero).

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

post.description: Queries and retrieves EPCIS event(s) that match the criteria specified in the query parameters.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Query parameter object. If two or more query parameters are defined, then the AND operation is always applied.

post.description: Captures and stores EPCIS events. This does not imply any relationship between these EPCIS  events.

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: A list of EPCIS events to be captured.

parameters.name: ERP stock
parameters.description: The ERP stock to create.

get.description: Lists the ERP stock summaries for a given location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location for which to list the ERP stocks.

parameters.name: from_event_time
parameters.description: Retrieve the ERP stock summaries from this time.

parameters.name: until_event_time
parameters.description: Retrieve the ERP stock summaries until this time.

get.description: Retrieves details of an ERP stock for a given identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the ERP stock to retrieve.

parameters.name: with_excluded
parameters.description: Boolean parameter that indicates if we want to include excluded GTINs from ERP stock.

get.description: Retrieves a summary for an ERP stock.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the ERP stock summary to retrieve.

get.description: Retrieves location information by location identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Location identifier for a location of type 'site' or 'location'.

get.description: Retrieves organizations for the current active authentication token.
Gets list of stores, optionally filtered by store code. Note that sublocations will not be included in the response.

parameters.name: store_code
parameters.description: Defines the LocationObject to retrieve based on store code.

get.description: Lists RFID counts for a certain location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location identifier to retrieve the count for.

parameters.name: from_event_time
parameters.description: Limits the returned list to counts with an event time after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: until_event_time
parameters.description: Limits the returned list to counts with an event time before the specified date and time.

get.description: Retrieves an RFID count.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location identifier to retrieve the count for.

parameters.name: gtins[]
parameters.description: Filter by GTIN. When omitted: returns all available GTINs, so no filtering based on GTIN is applied.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time of the count to retrieve (relates to the event_time of the count). When omitted: the response will be the latest RFID count.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

get.description:
Returns the real time stock at a certain location in unique items (SGTINs). Items are returned based on their last known bizLocation (location) as registered via the EPCIS Capture API. The response contains a list of stocks for all matching (sub)locations based on the given parameters:
* If the stock for a store without sublocations is requested, the stocks list in the response will contain one entry containing the stock for the entire store. 
* If a store has sublocations, the list of stocks in the response will contain an entry each for the sublocations.
* If a store has stock for both sublocations and store, the list of stocks in the response contains entries for the store and the sublocations with stock.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location identifier of a store or a sublocation.

parameters.name: location_types[]
parameters.description:
Filter on sublocation types: only stock on sublocations of the specified types will be returned. Multiple  sublocation types can be specified.
Valid sublocation types are:
    STOCK_ROOM, SALES_FLOOR,
    OFFSITE_STORAGE and
    FOREIGN.
Default behavior is to return stocks for all sublocation types except FOREIGN.

get.description:
Returns the real time stock at a certain location per GTIN. Items are returned based on their last known bizLocation (location) as registered via the EPCIS Capture API. The response contains a list of stocks for all matching (sub)locations based on the given parameters:
* If the stock for a store without sublocations is requested, the stocks list in the response will contain one entry containing the stock for the entire store. 
* If a store has sublocations, the list of stocks in the response will contain an entry each for the sublocations.
* If a store has stock for both sublocations and store, the list of stocks in the response contains entries for the store and the sublocations with stock.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location identifier of a store or a sublocation.

parameters.name: location_types[]
parameters.description:
Filter on sublocation types: only stock on sublocations of the specified types will be returned. Multiple  sublocation types can be specified.
Valid sublocation types are:
    STOCK_ROOM, SALES_FLOOR,
    OFFSITE_STORAGE and
    FOREIGN.
Default behavior is to return stocks for all sublocation types except FOREIGN.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

get.description:
Returns the real time stock at a certain location in unique items (SGTINs), grouped by disposition. Items are returned based on their last known bizLocation (location) as registered via the EPCIS Capture API. The response contains a list of stocks for all matching (sub)locations based on the given parameters:
* If the stock for a store without sublocations is requested, the stocks list in the response will contain one entry containing the stock for the entire store. 
* If a store has sublocations, the list of stocks in the response will contain an entry each for the sublocations.
* If a store has stock for both sublocations and store, the list of stocks in the response contains entries for the store and the sublocations with stock.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location identifier of a store or a sublocation.

parameters.name: location_types[]
parameters.description:
Filter on sublocation types: only stock on sublocations of the specified types will be returned. Multiple sublocation types can be  specified.
Valid sublocation types are:
    STOCK_ROOM, SALES_FLOOR,
    OFFSITE_STORAGE and
    FOREIGN.
Default behavior is to return stocks for all  sublocation types except FOREIGN.

parameters.name: dispositions[]
parameters.description: Filter on disposition(s): only stock of the specified disposition(s) will be returned.

post.description: Captures and stores a shipment notice. Shipment notices always have the status 'INTRANSIT'.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Shipment notice to capture.

delete.description: Deletes a shipment notice. If the shipment notice was created through an aggregation event, this event will be retracted.

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: Parent identifier of a shipment.

get.description: Retrieves a list of shipment summaries. Either source or destination is required, not both.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source of a shipment.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Destination of a shipment.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the shipment.

parameters.name: last_modified_since
parameters.description: Find shipments that have been modified since specified time. When omitted: default is present minus one month.

get.description: Retrieves a shipment based on the parent identifier.

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: Parent identifier of a shipment.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

parameters.name: WorkflowEvent
parameters.description: A workflow event to capture and store.

get.description: Returns a set of workflow events that matches the criteria specified in the query parameters.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description:
Location identifier of the workflow event.
When omitted: return all workflow events for all locations.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Type of the workflow event.
When omitted: return all workflow events for all types.

parameters.name: from_event_time
parameters.description:
Minimum event time of the workflow event.
When omitted: returns all workflow events since the epoch.

parameters.name: until_event_time
parameters.description:
Maximum event time of the workflow event.
When omitted: returns all workflow events up until now.

country_code.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 two letter country code.

location.description: Location identifier of the store the difference list will be approved for.

rfid_time.description: The date and time of the RFID count to be used.

erp_stock_id.description: The identifier of the ERP stock to use.

approved_gtins.description: List of GTINs for which the differences will be approved.

id.description: Unique identifier for the created approved difference list

location.description: Location identifier of the store the difference list is for.

id.description: Unique identifier for the approved difference list

gtins.description: List of GTINs in the exported approved difference list.

articles.description: Article details like name, size, etc., corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

approved_on.description: Date and time when this difference list was approved.

approved_by.description: Person that approved the difference list.

erp_stock_id.description: The identifier of the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

erp_stock_time.description: The date and time of the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

erp_quantity.description: Quantity of items in the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

erp_gtin_quantity.description: Quantity of GTINs in the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

rfid_stock_time.description: The date and time of the RFID count that was used in this approved difference list.

rfid_quantity.description: Quantity of items in the RFID count that was used in this approved difference list.

rfid_gtin_quantity.description: Quantity of GTINs in the RFID count that was used in this approved difference list.

absolute_difference.description: Absolute difference in items between the RFID count and ERP stock.

plus_difference.description: Positive difference in items between the RFID count and ERP stock.

minus_difference.description: Negative difference in items between the RFID count and ERP stock.

export_status.description: Transfer status of this approved difference list towards the ERP system. Values: NOT_EXPORTED, EXPORTED or ERROR

export_time.description: Date and time when this approved difference list was exported.

extern_ref.description: The extern_ref field of the ERP stock used for this approved difference list.

accuracy.description: Accuracy relation between the ERP stock and RFID stock, according to the SMAPE definition.

approved_quantity.description: Quantity of approved GTINs in the exported approved difference list.

location.description: Location identifier of the store the difference list is for.

id.description: Unique identifier for the approved difference list

gtins.description: List of GTINs in the approved difference list.

articles.description: Article details like name, size, etc., corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

approved.description: Approved status, corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

approved_on.description: Date and time when this difference list was approved.

approved_by.description: Person that approved the difference list.

erp_stock_id.description: The identifier of the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

erp_stock_time.description: The date and time of the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

erp_quantity.description: Quantity of items in the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

erp_gtin_quantity.description: Quantity of GTINs in the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

rfid_stock_time.description: The date and time of the RFID count that was used in this approved difference list.

rfid_quantity.description: Quantity of items in the RFID count that was used in this approved difference list.

rfid_gtin_quantity.description: Quantity of GTINs in the RFID count that was used in this approved difference list.

absolute_difference.description: Absolute difference in items between the RFID count and ERP stock.

plus_difference.description: Positive difference in items between the RFID count and ERP stock.

minus_difference.description: Negative difference in items between the RFID count and ERP stock.

export_status.description: Transfer status of this approved difference list towards the ERP system. Values: NOT_EXPORTED, EXPORTED or ERROR

export_time.description: Date and time when this approved difference list was exported.

extern_ref.description: The extern_ref field of the ERP stock used for this approved difference list.

accuracy.description: Accuracy relation between the ERP stock and RFID stock, according to the SMAPE definition.

erp_stock.description: ERP stock quantity, corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

rfid_stock.description: RFID count quantity, corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

location.description: Location identifier of the store the difference list is for.

id.description: Unique identifier for the approved difference list

approved_on.description: Date and time when this difference list was approved.

approved_by.description: Person that approved the difference list.

erp_stock_id.description: The identifier of the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

erp_stock_time.description: The date and time of the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

erp_quantity.description: Quantity of items in the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

erp_gtin_quantity.description: Quantity of GTINs in the ERP stock that was used in this approved difference list.

rfid_stock_time.description: The date and time of the RFID count that was used in this approved difference list.

rfid_quantity.description: Quantity of items in the RFID count that was used in this approved difference list.

rfid_gtin_quantity.description: Quantity of GTINs in the RFID count that was used in this approved difference list.

absolute_difference.description: Absolute difference in items between the RFID count and ERP stock.

plus_difference.description: Positive difference in items between the RFID count and ERP stock.

minus_difference.description: Negative difference in items between the RFID count and ERP stock.

export_status.description: Transfer status of this approved difference list towards the ERP system. Values: NOT_EXPORTED, EXPORTED or ERROR

export_time.description: Date and time when this approved difference list was exported.

extern_ref.description: The extern_ref field of the ERP stock used for this approved difference list.

accuracy.description: Accuracy relation between the ERP stock and RFID stock, according to the SMAPE definition.

gtin.description: GTIN-14, length of 14 digits. Primary key to identify an article (or SKU). GTIN-14 value is validated against the GS1 standard. When no GTIN-14 is provided, it will be generated and unique for this organization.

barcodes.description: Contains all barcodes for this article, for example EAN-13 and UPC-12. Minimum of 1 linear barcode is required.

code.description: Article code as assigned by the retailer. No relation to GTIN or other barcodes is assumed.

season.description: The season the product belongs to.

option.description: Combination of name and color of an article. When omitted: option is automatically filled with name and color fields.

style.description: Name of the article, independent of color. When omitted: style is automatically filled with name.

supplier.description: Supplier name. Can also be factory name.

category.description: Category name. Used to group articles (or SKU's) in the web interface and the apps

prices.description: Contains various prices that can be country specific.

last_updated.description: The time when the article was last updated. This field will be overwritten when new article data is uploaded.

articles.description: Article details like name, size, etc.

extern_ref.description: The external reference as specified in the request.

records_total.description: Total number of records, before filtering (i.e. the total number of records in the database).

records_filtered.description: Total number of records, after filtering (i.e. the total number of records after filtering has been applied - not just the number of records being returned for this page of data).

type.description: Barcode type. Typically ean_13 or upc_12. Values are described in lowercase, digits and underscores. Values can include ean_8, ean_13, upc_12, gs1_128, code_39.
An identifier that indicates what kind of business transaction this BusinessTransaction denotes.

biz_transaction.description: An identifier that denotes a specific business transaction.

absolute_difference.description: Absolute difference of this difference list in number of items.

gross_difference.description: Gross difference of this difference list as a percentage.

not_on_shelf_gtin_quantity.description: The number of articles (GTINs) that are not available on shelf, but are available in a stock room.

not_on_shelf_percentage.description: Same as above, but as a percentage of the total number of GTINs in the store.

store_quantity.description: The number of items in the entire store.

stock_ratio.description: Percentage of items in the entire store that are in stock rooms.

erp_stock_id.description: ID of ERP stock used to generate the summary.

erp_stock_time.description: Time of ERP stock used to generate the summary.

rfid_stock_time.description: Time of RFID stock used to generate the summary.

erp_quantity.description: Number of items in ERP stock

rfid_quantity.description: Number of items in RFID stock

erp_gtin_quantity.description: Number of GTINs in ERP stock

rfid_gtin_quantity.description: Number of GTINs in RFID stock. The number of articles (GTINs) that are available in the store (including sales floors and stock rooms).

plus_difference.description: Positive difference of this difference list in number of items (where there is more items in rfid count than in erp import).

minus_difference.description: Negative difference of this difference list in number of items (where there is more items in erp import than in rfid count).

stock_rooms_quantity.description: The number of items in all stock rooms.

sales_floors_quantity.description: The number of items in all sales floors.

shipments_in_transit.description: The number of shipments that are in transit

shipments_average_received_percentage.description: The average received percentage over the shipments in the last 10 weeks

type.description: An identifier that indicates what kind of destination this Destination denotes.

destination.description: An identifier that denotes a specific destination.

gtins.description: List of GTINs in the difference list.

articles.description: Article details like name, size, etc., corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

erp_stock.description: ERP stock quantity, corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

rfid_stock.description: RFID count quantity, corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

erp_stock_time.description: Date and time of the ERP stock creation.

rfid_stock_time.description: Date and time of the RFID count creation.

erp_gtin_quantity.description: Total quantity of GTINs in the ERP stock.

rfid_gtin_quantity.description: Total quantity of GTINs in the RFID count.

accuracy.description: Accuracy relation between the ERP stock and RFID count, according to the SMAPE definition.

id.description: EPCIS event message identifier, assigned by the creator of the event. This identifier must be unique within the organization.

action.description: The action field describes the eventâ€™s relationship to the lifecycle of the object, aggregation, transaction or transformation.

disposition.description: The business condition of the objects associated with the EPCs, presumed to hold true until contradicted by a subsequent event.

stored_id.description: Identifier for the event, automatically assigned when the event is stored in the database.

event_id.description: An identifier for this event as specified by the capturing application, globally unique across all events other than error declarations.

event_time.description: The date and time at which the EPCIS Capturing Applications asserts the event occurred.

record_time.description: The date and time at which this event was recorded by an EPCIS Repository.

event_time_zone_offset.description: The time zone offset in effect at the time and place the event occurred, expressed as an offset from UTC.

biz_step.description: The business step of which this event was a part.

biz_location.description: The business location where the objects associated with the containing and contained EPCs may be found, until contradicted by a subsequent event.

read_point.description: The read point at which the event took place.

source_list.description: An unordered list of Source elements that provide context about the originating endpoint of a business transfer of which this event is a part.

destination_list.description: An unordered list of Destination elements that provide context about the terminating endpoint of a business transfer of which this event is a part.

biz_transaction_list.description: An unordered list of business transactions that define the context of this event.

error_declaration.description: If present, indicates that this event serves to assert that the assertions made by a prior event are in error.

parent_id.description: The identifier of the parent of the association.

child_epcs.description: An unordered list of the EPCs of contained objects identified by instance-level identifiers.

child_quantity_list.description: An unordered list of one or more QuantityElements identifying (at the class level) contained objects.

ilmd.description: Instance/Lot master data (Section 7.3.6) that describes the objects created during this event.

epc_list.description: An unordered list of one or more EPCs naming specific objects to which the event  pertained.

quantity_list.description: An unordered list of one or more QuantityElements identifying (at the class level) objects to which the event pertained.

input_epc_list.description: An unordered list of one or more EPCs identifying (at the instance level) objects that were inputs to the transformation.

output_epc_list.description: An unordered list of one or more EPCs naming (at the instance level) objects that were outputs from the transformation.

input_quantity_list.description: An unordered list of one or more QuantityElements identifying (at the class level) objects that were inputs to the transformation.

output_quantity_list.description: An unordered list of one or more QuantityElements identifying (at the class level) objects that were outputs from the transformation.

transformation_id.description: A unique identifier that links this event to other TransformationEvents having an identical value of 'transformationID'.

parameters.description: List of query parameters used to query the EPCIS repository.

storedId.description: Identifier for the event, automatically assigned when the event is stored in the database.

declarationTime.description: Date and time of the error declaration.

location.description: Location identifier of the store that the ERP stock belongs to.

event_time.description: The time the ERP stock was exported from the ERP system.

extern_ref.description: An external reference for the ERP stock, defined by the 3rd party integrator.

status.description: Current status of the ERP stock. 'Validating' means that the stock count is currently being processed and validated. 'Accepted' means that the ERP stock has been validated and processed successfully.

quantity.description: Total quantity of items in the ERP stock.

excluded_quantity.description: Total quantity of excluded items in the ERP stock.

gtin_quantity.description: Total quantity of GTINs in the ERP stock.

excluded_gtin_quantity.description: Total quantity of excluded GTINs in the ERP stock.

in_use.description: Indicates whether the ERP stock is used in a difference list. If it is used, the ERP stock can not be deleted anymore.

quantity_list.description: List of GtinQuantity objects; specifying GTIN and the quantity and if the GTIN should be excluded from the expected stock and difference list.

ErpStock.description: Provides summary information about an ERP stock.

id.description: Identifier of the created ERP stock.

location.description: Location identifier of the store that the ERP stock belongs to.

event_time.description: The time the ERP stock was exported from the ERP system.

extern_ref.description: An external reference for the ERP stock, defined by the 3rd party integrator.

status.description: Current status of the ERP stock. 'Validating' means that the stock count is currently being processed and validated. 'Accepted' means that the ERP stock has been validated and processed successfully.

quantity.description: Total quantity of items in the ERP stock.

excluded_quantity.description: Total quantity of excluded items in the ERP stock.

gtin_quantity.description: Total quantity of GTINs in the ERP stock.

excluded_gtin_quantity.description: Total quantity of excluded GTINs in the ERP stock.

in_use.description: Indicates whether the ERP stock is used in a difference list. If it is used, the ERP stock can not be deleted anymore.

ErpStockSummary.description: Provides summary information about an ERP stock.

declaration_time.description: The date and time at which the declaration of error is made.

reason.description: An element from a standard vocabulary that specifies the reason the prior event is considered erroneous.

corrective_event_ids.description: If present, indicates that the events having the specified URIs as the value of their eventID fields are to be considered as "corrections" to the event declared erroneous by this event.

ErrorDeclaration.description: A ErrorDeclaration is a structure that identifies a prior EPCISEvent is in error.

gtin.description: The GTIN for which the quantity is specified.

quantity.description: A number that specifies how many or how much of the specified GTIN is denoted by this GtinQuantity. Negative values are allowed.

exclude.description: When set to true, the GTIN is excluded from the expected stock and the difference list. Default value is set to `false`.

GtinQuantity.description: A GtinQuantity is a structure that identifies GTIN plus quantity.

name.description: Name of the store or location.

address.description: Address details. Only when type equals 'site'.

children.description: List of sublocations (if any). Only when type equals 'site'.

parent_id.description: Location identifier of parent (only when type = 'location', 'location_internal'or 'location_external').

store_code.description: Store code (branch ID) of the store or location (as defined by retailer). Only when type equals 'site'.

type.description: Type of the value querying for.

value.description: Value to be queried for within the named parameter.

values.description: Values to be queried for within the named parameter.

currency.description: The currency for the specified region (ISO 4217 currency code).

region.description: The country defining the region where this price is used (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 two letter country code).

quantity.description: A number that specifies how many or how much of the specified EPCClass is denoted by this QuantityElement.

uom.description: If present, specifies a unit of measure by which the specified quantity is to be interpreted as a physical measure, specifying how much of the specified EPCClass is denoted by this QuantityElement.

epc_class.description: A class-level identifier for the class to which the specified quantity of objects belongs.

QuantityElement.description: A QuantityElement is a structure that identifies objects identified by a specific class-level identifier, either a specific quantity or an unspecified quantity.

quantity.description: Number of articles in the database.

time.description: Date and time of the stock.

quantity.description: Quantity of items in the stock.

parent_id.description: Parent ID of the Shipment according to the EPCIS standards. When the shipment is created by an aggregationEvent, the Parent ID is the same as the Parent ID of the aggregationEvent otherwise it's created by the extern_ref from a shipment. When this isn't conform standards, it's converted to match it.

extern_ref.description: Reference for the shipment as defined by the retailer, like a shipment number.

last_modified_at.description: Date and time of last modification. Should not lie before creation time.

status.description: Status of the shipment. Values: INTRANSIT or RECEIVED

received_percentage.description: Received percentage for the expected (quantity of) GTINs.

gtins.description: List of GTINs in the shipment.

sent_quantities.description: List of sent quantities, corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

received_quantities.description: List of received quantities, corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

articles.description: Article details like name, size, etc., corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

parent_id.description: Parent ID of the Shipment according to the EPCIS standards. When the shipment is created by an aggregationEvent, the Parent ID is the same as the Parent ID of the aggregationEvent otherwise it's created by the extern_ref from a shipment. When this isn't conform standards, it's converted to match it.

extern_ref.description: Reference for the shipment as defined by the retailer, like a shipment number.

last_modified_at.description: Date and time of last modification. Should not lie before creation time.

status.description: Status of the shipment. Values: INTRANSIT or RECEIVED

received_percentage.description: Received percentage for the expected (quantity of) GTINs.

description.description: The size description for the specified region. Can contain both size and length.

region.description: The country defining the region where this size description is used (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 two letter country code).

type.description: An identifier that indicates what kind of source this Source denotes.

source.description: An identifier that denotes a specific source.

location.description: Location identifier of the store or sublocation that the RFID count belongs to.

event_time.description: Date and time of the RFID count.

start_time.description: Date and time the RFID count started.

quantity.description: Total quantity of items in the RFID count.

gtin_quantity.description: Total quantity of GTINs in the RFID count.

in_use.description: Indicates whether the RFID count is used in a difference list. If it is used, the RFID count can not be deleted anymore.

is_complete.description: Indicates whether the RFID count has been completed.

Stock.description: Provides summary information about an RFID count.

gtins.description: List of GTINs in the stock.

locations.description: List of location identifiers in the stock, corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

quantities.description: Stock quantity, corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

time.description: Date and time of the stock.

articles.description: Article details like name, size, etc., corresponding to the GTIN in the GTIN list.

location.description: Location identifier of the store or sublocation that the RFID count belongs to.

event_time.description: Date and time of the RFID count.

start_time.description: Date and time the RFID count started.

quantity.description: Total quantity of items in the RFID count.

gtin_quantity.description: Total quantity of GTINs in the RFID count.

in_use.description: Indicates whether the RFID count is used in a difference list. If it is used, the RFID count can not be deleted anymore.

is_complete.description: Indicates whether the RFID count has been completed.

StockSummary.description: Provides summary information about an RFID count.

type.description: Type of the workflow. Values: cycle_count_started, cycle_count_finished or partial_count_finished.

location.description: The location identifier of the location for which the workflow is defined. Usually this is a store.

event_time.description:
Client-side time when the user decided the event ended.
This is not the moment of sending the workflow event nor is it the moment when the last EPC was observed.

start_time.description: Time when the first EPC was observed.

epc_count.description: The total number of EPCs that were affected in the referenced message_ids.

message_ids.description: List of EPCIS event message identifiers, the 'id' field in the EPCIS event.These events contain the actual EPCs that were affected.

client_id.description: OAuth Client ID of the device generating the workflow event.

type.description: Type of the organization. Values: ORGANIZATION or BUSINESS_PARTNER.

linked.description: Linked organization, other organization(s) you have access to.

settings.description: Series of key-value pairs representing the actual settings.

version.description: The version of the settings: a higher number means newer. Use this to check if your local cache of the settings is outdated.

target_type.description: The type of target in the organizational structure. Values: CustomerOrganization, Division, Store, Sublocation

target_id.description: The numeric identifier for the target.

target_name.description: Human readable name of the target.

location_id.description: If present, the location_id of the target.
